III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has performed oral sex on two different youth at facility.
One of the sexual acts was conducted in exchange for youth's
ability to use the other youth's phone.
Investigation Interviews:
Chief Administrator/Complaint Source was interviewed via
phone on October 16, 2023, and face to face at the facility on
October 20, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief
Administrator reported these allegations were brought up to
Supervisor from Youth D and Youth E on October 13, 2023. She
reported one of the youth disclosed this happened around 1am but
could not give a date or even a month of when this occurred. Chief
Administrator reported due to the zero-tolerance review regarding the
prevention of sexual abuse policy, a clinician had come onsite to
speak with the youth to do a risk assessment and there was denial of
this occurring from the youth. The facility also went through all the
youth’s phones to see if there were any videos or pictures and there
were none found. Chief Administrator reported the youth are allowed
to spend time in each other’s rooms and staff must complete room
checks in verbal intervals of no more than fifteen minutes. She
reported on the third shift they like to have two staff working if they
can. Chief Administrator reported if there is only one third shift staff
member working then it is just their job to focus on bedroom checks
and supervision and no cleaning is required to be done. She reported
that the youth should be keeping the bedroom doors open. Since the
report of these allegations, all youth have their own rooms, no one
should be spending time in each other’s rooms and all bedroom
doors are locked but youth can exit the room, but cannot get into
each other’s rooms without staff unlocking the door. Chief
Administrator reported video footage was reviewed from the past two
2

weeks during night shift and there was footage showing Youth A
going into Youth B and Youth C’s room.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
20, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
he is good friends with Youth B but not such great friends with Youth
C. He reported he was upset with Youth C because he had taken a
video of him when he was horseplaying to see who was stronger and
showed it to people at school. Youth A reported there was nothing
sexual with the video and everyone had clothes on. He reported he
has never gone into another youth’s room when it was bedtime, and
no one has ever shared a bed with him. Youth A reported he has
never done anything with anyone sexually at the facility and reported
he has never been forced to do anything. He reported staff are
always doing room checks and youth used to just come in and out of
other youth’s rooms to hang out. He reported nothing ever sexual
has occurred.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
20, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported
he has never done anything sexual at the facility. He reported he
would never do anything sexual with a male because that is not
accepted in his country. Youth B reported if he knew someone was
doing something sexual at the facility he would ask to be moved right
away. He reported youth do hang out in each other’s room and noted
Youth A, Youth D, and Youth E have all come into his room to hang
out, listen to music, and talk. Youth B reported staff do a good job at
supervising and are always doing room checks. Youth B denied any
video and noted he has provided his phone to staff to check.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
20, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported
that he has no concerns with any boundaries of the youth at the
facility. He reported he has not heard of or been a part of any sexual
acts at the facility. Youth C reported he does not know why anyone
would say that something sexual is occurring with any of the youth at
the facility. He reported youth are allowed to go in each other’s
rooms to hang out and staff are always doing checks. Youth C
reported he did not know anything about any video.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
20, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported
he has never seen anything sexual happen between the youth, but
he has heard sexual noises at night. He reported he had told Staff 3
about this one night. Youth D reported he did not want to go into any
more details. He reported he has heard rumors about a video but
does not know what is on the video because he never saw it. Youth
D reported one night when he was sharing a room with Youth A he
3

believes he saw another person in Youth A’s bed under the covers.
He reported he could remember any other details because he was
half asleep and did not know if it was true or not. Youth D reported
staff are always doing room checks and Staff 2 does even more
room checks than the other staff. He reported the other staff do room
checks as required it is just Staff 2 does more checks. Youth D
reported he has gotten frustrated with Staff 3 at night because he has
come out of his room and Staff 3 redirects him to go back to his
room.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
20, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported
he went into Youth B and Youth C’s room to pray one day recently
with Youth C. He got upset with Youth A and Youth B because they
were horse playing. Youth E reported he confronted Youth A and
Youth B about it, and they said they were just playing around. He
reported in his culture it is inappropriate for men to touch men. Youth
E reported staff are doing room checks no more than every fifteen
minutes. He stated that he had never seen a video on Youth C’s
phone.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 16, 2023, and October 20, 2023, in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Supervisor reported on Friday, October 13, 2023,
he picked up Youth D and Youth E from school. He reported Youth D
made the disclosure that Youth A had been performing sexual acts
on Youth B. Supervisor reported Youth D reported this happened in
Youth B’s bedroom. Supervisor was asked if any youth shared a
room, and he reported Youth B and Youth C shared a room and all
the other youths had their own rooms. When asked how Youth D got
this information, Supervisor reported Youth D heard it from the youth
at the facility. Supervisor reported Youth E also disclosed in the car
that Youth A had performed sexual acts on Youth C. Youth E
disclosed he heard the youth talking about there possibly being a
video of this on someone’s phone, but Supervisor reported he went
through all the youth’s cell phones and found no video or photos.
Youth E also reported to Supervisor he heard Youth A perform
sexual acts on Youth B to use Youth B’s cell phone. Neither Youth D
nor Youth E saw any of the sexual acts occur or knew the date of this
occurring. Supervisor reported the youth are not allowed to go into
each other’s bedrooms when it is bedtime but can hang out in each
other’s room during the day. Supervisor reported when a youth is in
their room staff should be doing interval checks for no more than
fifteen minutes.
Director was interviewed via phone on October 20, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Director reported on October
13, 2023, she received a phone call from Supervisor and reported
4

the disclosures made in these allegations. She reported police did
come out to the facility due to their protocol, but they just reported
due to the youth all being age of consent no investigation would
occur. Director reported she came onsite after the disclosures were
made and made sure all the youth were moved into single rooms.
She reported herself and Supervisor talked with all the youth about
safety. Due to the concerns of the video, all the youth’s cell phones
were taken for them to review for any concerning videos or pictures.
Director reported all the youth have their own cell phones and there
was nothing found in the phones, including the deleted area of the
phone. All youth were talked to alone and all youth denied seeing
anything sexual happen between the youth. Director reported Youth
E reported he went into Youth B and Youth C’s room so that he could
pray with Youth C. He reported Youth A was in the room during that
time and he got frustrated with Youth A and Youth B because they
were horseplaying and that is disrespectful to his culture. Youth D
disclosed in his meeting that he did share a room with Youth A for
about two days and believes he saw two people under blankets. He
stated that he also heard noises from another room one night. Youth
A, Youth B, and Youth C disclosed no sexual concerns.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
20, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Therapist reported
he works with all the youth at the facility and never heard of these
concerns until he was brought in to talk with the youth after these
disclosures. He reported Youth E reported to him that Youth A, Youth
B, and Youth C like to horseplay a lot, meaning they like to play fight.
Youth D reported to Therapist, he heard sexual sounds from his
room in the middle of the night and knew Youth A was in Youth B
and Youth C’s bedroom. Therapist reported Youth D’s bedroom is
next to Youth B and Youth C’s room. He reported Youth D never
disclosed seeing anything sexual and would not explain the sexual
noise he was hearing. Therapist reported he talked with Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C individually and they disclosed no sexual
concerns. He stated the youth talked about horseplay. Therapist
reported he completed sexual risk assessments on all the youth and
there were no concerns noted. All youth told him they feel safe at the
facility, and no one is forcing them to do any sexual acts.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October 20,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported her
role is to take youth to different appointments and direct care staff on
second shift. She reported Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C has never
reported any sexual abuse concerns and she has never seen any
sexualized behavior at the facility. Staff 1 reported she took Youth D
to get his haircut on Saturday, October 14, 2023, and he reported
concerns about hearing sexual moaning noises coming from Youth B
and Youth C’s bedroom. She reported Youth D disclosed he believed
5

Youth A was in that bedroom when he heard the noises. Staff 1
reported she had talked with Supervisor about these concerns since
Youth D disclosed, he told Supervisor as well. She reported Youth D
also saw a video from Youth C where it looked like Youth A was
giving Youth C oral sex. Staff 1 reported staff went through all the
youth’s phones and found no video. Staff 1 reported before this
incident the youth were allowed to go into each other’s rooms to
hang out and staff would do sporadic room checks no more than
every fifteen minutes. She reported now no one is allowed in each
other’s rooms.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on October 20, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she has been
working at the facility for a little bit over two years and was primarily
working on third shift until she moved to second shift last month. Staff
2 reported she was made aware of the allegations and reported she
has never had any boundary concerns for any of the youth. She
reported redirection has to be given to the boys because they will
horseplay by smacking each other but follow the redirection when
given. Staff 2 reported the youth would go into each other’s
bedrooms to hang out and watch videos on their cell phones. She
reported room checks occur in random intervals of no more than
fifteen minutes. Staff reported the boys have been redirected as well
about making sexual jokes, but it has never been about one another.
She reported when she was on third shift, she completed room
checks as well and never found another youth in someone else’s
bed. Staff 2 reported she was working when Youth A shared a room
with Youth D and never saw anyone extra in their room. She reported
Youth A and Youth D only shared a room for a couple of days
because Youth D snores. Staff 2 reported none of the youth ever
disclosed to her any reports of sexual concerns.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on October 20, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he has been
working at the facility for about a month and works on third shift. He
reported the main part of his job is to complete room checks under
fifteen minutes in variable intervals. Staff 3 reported has never had
any concerns with his bedroom checks and never has had concerns
reported to him. He stated sometimes when he comes on to shift,
some of the youth are still hanging out in each other’s rooms and he
has to encourage them to go to their own rooms due to it being
bedtime. Staff 3 reported there have been no issues with the
redirection. Staff 3 reported he had no concerns with the youth’s
boundaries.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on October 23, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported he has been
working at the facility for over a year and stated he has never had
6

any concerns with boundaries with the youth. He reported he works
third shift and does room checks on the youth in interval times no
more than fifteen minutes apart. He stated that he had never seen a
youth in another youth’s room that should not be. Staff 4 reported he
was working when Youth A and Youth D did share a room and never
saw any concerns during that room check. He reported the youth
have spent time in each other’s room to watch videos, talk or pray.
Staff 4 reported he never saw or heard of any concerning behaviors.
Case Manager 1 and Case Manager 2 were interviewed face to
face separately at the facility on October 20, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Case Manager 1 reported he
works with Youth A and Youth C. Case Manager 2 reported she
works with Youth B. They both reported they had never heard sexual
concerns from the youth. Case Manager 1 reported he works with
Youth E who reported he does not like when the youth horseplay
because it is inappropriate in his culture.
Conference call was held with MDHHS Worker on November 8,
2023. MDHHS worker reported there are no findings to their
investigation.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on October 16, 2023. When walking
into the bedroom area where the youth’s room are it is down one
main hallway. At the start of the hallway there is a desk area facing
the hallway where staff can sit to watch the view of the hallway.
Youth D’s room is on the left of the hallway and next to his room was
the room Youth B and C were in. Directly across the hall from Youth
B and Youth C’s room is Youth A’s room. At the time of the tour all of
the youth are now in their own rooms and staff have to unlock the
bedroom door to allow the youth in.
Documents reviewed:
- Facility Room Check logs for Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C from 08/06/2023-10/17/2023- Room check logs
were completed appropriately for all the youth. Room checks
were all completed in variable intervals no more than fifteen
minutes between times.
- Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C facility files- There was no
incident report within the file noting any concerns of sexual
inappropriate behaviors.
- Facility incident reported dated 10/13/2023 and addendum
date 10/15/2023- The incident reported is consistent with the
interviews conducted with Supervisor and Director.
- Facility Staff to Resident Ratio Policy- The policy reports,
“When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-
7

on checks of residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed 15 minutes.” The policy does not note
any specifics about youth being allowed in other youth’s
rooms and what that supervision looks like.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with providing adequate
supervision for safety of the youth. There was no concrete
evidence found that any oral sex occurred between the youth. The
facility was completing all required room checks and when this
concern was brought to light increased supervision occurred. The
youth now all have separate rooms and staff have to unlock the
doors to allow a youth into their bedroom.
Technical assistance
It is recommended the facility create a protocol for requirements of
supervision if a youth is hanging out in another youth’s room such
as if the door should be open, what time of day is this allowed,
and what level of supervision is required.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
